intro: Scabiosa esfandiarii, commonly known as the Persian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa esfandiarii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
